intro: Tricuspis langloisii, commonly known as the three-lobed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. Tricuspis langloisii is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
